Class Floor

  • java.lang.Object
    • Floor

  • public class Floor
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains all the Person objects at the start of the simulation and assigns them their timeToArrive using a standard Gaussian distribution. Since we need a container with quick access that we won't be inserting anything to after the initial set-up stage, the ArrayList can do the job of holding the people on the floor.
    Author:
    Ivan Evtimov

    • Constructor Detail

      • Floor

        public Floor(int capacity)
        The constructor creates a new floor. It checks what was the number of the last floor that was created and sets this floor's number to the next value. It also creates an array list container with the indicated capacity.
        Parameters:
        capacity - the capcity for the floor.

    • Method Detail

      • getFloorNumber

        public int getFloorNumber()
        Accessor method to get the current floor's number.
        Returns:
        the current floor's number

      • getFloorSize

        public int getFloorSize()
        Accessor method to get the current floor's current size.
        Returns:
        the number of Person objects currently on the floor

      • fillUp

        public void fillUp(int numOfTenants,
          int seed,
          double mean,
          double variance)
            throws java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        This method fills up the floor with Tenant and Visitor objects where each one of them gets a randomly assigned timeToArrive. The objects are generated based on the number of Tenants. The number of visitors is determined by the number of tenants by dividing it by three. The visitors are 3 times less than the tenants.
        Parameters:
        numOfTenants - the number of tenants we want on this floor
        seed - the seed for the random number generator that will distribute the times to arrive for the person objects
        mean - the mean for the Gaussian distribution
        variance - the variance for the Gaussian distribution
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if the number of people we want to add exceeds the capacity we have set for teh floor

      • removePerson

        public Person removePerson(int index)
        This method returns the person who is supposed to go to the queue for the staircase and removes it from the Floor.

      • checkArrive

        public int checkArrive(int currentTime)
        Method to check if the time each Person has waited equals its assigned time to arrive.
        Parameters:
        currentTime - the current time step in the simulation
        Returns:
        the index of the person if some object has waited enough and -1 if no object has waited enough or the floor is empty

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Method to check if the floor is empty.
        Returns:
        true if size is equal to 0
